title: Calculus: Early Transcendentals
author: James Stewart
subject: Mathematics
description: Comprehensive textbook covering limits, derivatives, and integrals with real-world applications and examples.

title: Physics for Scientists and Engineers
author: Raymond A. Serway
subject: Science
description: Fundamental physics concepts including mechanics, thermodynamics, and wave motion with practical examples.

title: Introduction to Computer Science
author: John Zelle
subject: Computer Science
description: Python programming fundamentals with hands-on projects and problem-solving exercises.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
subject: Literature
description: Classic American novel exploring the Jazz Age, wealth, and the American Dream.

title: World History: Patterns of Interaction
author: Roger B. Beck
subject: History
description: Comprehensive world history from ancient civilizations to modern times with primary sources.

title: Psychology: Themes and Variations
author: Wayne Weiten
subject: Psychology
description: Comprehensive introduction to psychology covering major theories, research methods, and applications.

title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
author: Stephen R. Covey
subject: Self-Help
description: Transformative book on personal and professional effectiveness through proven principles and habits.

title: Rich Dad Poor Dad
author: Robert T. Kiyosaki
subject: Business
description: Personal finance education through contrasting financial philosophies and practical money management advice.

title: The Power of Now
author: Eckhart Tolle
subject: Self-Help
description: Spiritual guide to living in the present moment and finding inner peace and happiness.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
subject: Self-Help
description: Practical guide to building good habits and breaking bad ones through tiny changes and compound effects.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
subject: Literature
description: Timeless novel exploring racial injustice, moral growth, and the loss of innocence in the American South.

title: Organic Chemistry
author: John McMurry
subject: Science
description: Comprehensive organic chemistry textbook covering structure, reactions, and mechanisms with visual aids.

title: Microeconomics: Principles and Policy
author: William J. Baumol
subject: Business
description: Introduction to microeconomic principles including supply, demand, market structures, and policy applications.

title: The Art of War
author: Sun Tzu
subject: Philosophy
description: Ancient Chinese text on military strategy and tactics with applications to business and life.

title: Think and Grow Rich
author: Napoleon Hill
subject: Self-Help
description: Classic success book based on interviews with successful people and principles for achieving wealth.
